channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE DISCOVERED LEAKING/WET IN THE UNLOAD AREA. CAPS OF TWO BOTTLES BECAME LOOSE. CONTENTS LEAKED OUT AS A RESULT. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: UPON DISCOVERY, PACKAGE SECURED AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT AREA FOR PROCESSING.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND LEAKING/WET IN THE TRAILER BEFORE UNLOADING. PACKAGE SEEMED TO BE DAMAGED DURING TRANSIT. CAPS OF BOTTLES BECAME LOOSE AND CONTENTS LEAKED OUT AS A RESULT. PACKAGE SECURED IN HAZMAT DRUM AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT PROCESSING AREA. DescribePack: CAPS OF BOTTLES BEAME LOOSE. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: UPON DISCOVERY, PACKAGE SECURED AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT PROCESSING AREA.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: package loaded onto the non conveyable belt but was dropped causing the box to start leaking and was discovered by the time it made it to the load side DescribePack: when the package was dropped, the body of the bottle rupture causing the leak to start DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: sand was used to cover the spill and the package was contained in a salvage drum

item.title: Report E-2024040109
item.description:
Report E-2024040109

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-09T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: SAVANNAH
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to the product being impacted by other freight, approximately .5 teaspoon of Tufcote 3.3 PR High Solids Fast Dry Alkyd Primer - White (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the pallet and did not impact the trailer floor. The released product and 2 damaged cans were placed into a 30-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.
